exclusion: Place your hub or gateway into exclusion mode. Then: Hold button A + Press Button B 3x. If it is successful the LED will blink green.
inclusion: Enable the inclusion process on your Hub or Gateway. Hold down button A and press button B 3x quickly and your LED Bars will pulse blue signifying the switch is in inclusion mode. If successful, the switch LED Bars will flash Green and if unsuccessful, the LED Bars will flash Red.
label: LZW36
overview:
There are two different wireless protocols that are used to make this fan & light switch - Z-Wave and RF.

Z-Wave is what gives the switch remote (smart) control, whereas RF is what connects the switch to the module. In other words, your hub/gateway connects to your switch, where you can tell it to change the speed of the fan or the brightness of the lights. From there the switch sends an RF command to the module to physically make those commands happen at the fan itself.
usage:
1. Light Dimmer (and Scene Control*): This button can be used to increase or decrease the dimness level on your light. Press (hold) up to increase brightness and press (hold) down to decrease the brightness. Also, a single press will send a scene command to your hub.
  2. Light On/Off Button (and Scene Control*): Press this button to turn on and off the fan light(s). This button can also be used to trigger Z-Wave scenes. You may add up to 7 scenes (Tap x, 2x, 3x, 4x, 5x, Hold, Release).
  3. Light RGB LED Bar (with Notifications*): Shows the level at which the fan light(s) are set at. In addition, it can be used as a notifier for various events (i.e.: turn purple if front door is open).
  4. Fan Speed (and Scene Control*): This button can be used to increase or decrease the speed of your fan. Press (hold) up to increase the speed and press (hold) down to decrease the speed. Also, a single press will send a scene command to your hub.
  5. Fan On/Off Button (and Scene Control*): Press this button to turn on and off the fan. This button can also be used to trigger Z-Wave scenes. You may add up to 7 scenes (Tap x, 2x, 3x, 4x, 5x, Hold, Release).
  6. Light RGB LED Bar (with Notifications*): Shows the level at which the fan speed is set at. In addition, it can be used as a notifier for various events (i.e.: turn red when your alarm is armed).
  7. Air Gap Switch: This will reboot the switch if it needs to be rebooted (NOTE: The air-gap switch will not cut power to the module).NOT SHOWN: Energy Monitoring* and Scene Control* are built-in features of this switch as well

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: Light LED Color
channels.overview: This is the color of the Light LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: Fan LED Color
channels.overview: This is the color of the Fan LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

parameters.label: Light Dimming Speed
parameters.overview: This changes the speed in which the attached light dims up or down. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed.

parameters.label: Light Dimming Speed (From Switch)
parameters.overview: This changes the speed in which the attached light dims up or down when controlled from the physical switch. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1.

parameters.label: Light Ramp Rate
parameters.overview: This changes the speed in which the attached light turns on or off. For example, when a user sends the switch a basicSet(value: 0xFF) or basicSet(value: 0x00), this is the speed in which those actions take place. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1.

parameters.label: Light Ramp Rate (From Switch)
parameters.overview: This changes the speed in which the attached light turns on or off from the physical switch. For example, when a user presses the up or down button, this is the speed in which those actions take place. A setting of 0 should turn the light immediately on or off (almost like an on/off switch). Increasing the value should slow down the transition speed. A setting of 99 should keep this in sync with parameter 1.

parameters.label: Minimum Light Level
parameters.overview: The minimum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that does not turn on or flickers at a lower level.

parameters.label: Maximum Light Level
parameters.overview: The maximum level that the dimmer allows the bulb to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has an LED bulb that reaches its maximum level before the dimmer value of 99.

parameters.label: Minimum Fan Level
parameters.overview: The minimum level that the dimmer allows the fan to be dimmed to. Useful when the user has a fan that does not turn at a lower level.

parameters.label: Maximum Fan Level
parameters.overview: The maximum level that the dimmer allows the fan to be dimmed to.

parameters.label: Auto Off Light Timer
parameters.overview: Automatically turns the light switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started that is the duration of this setting. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off.

parameters.label: Auto Off Fan Timer
parameters.overview: Automatically turns the fan switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started that is the duration of this setting. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off.

parameters.label: Default Light Level (Local)
parameters.overview: Default level for the dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.

parameters.label: Default Light Level (Z-Wave)
parameters.overview: Default level for the dimmer when it is powered on from a Z-Wave command. A setting of 0 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.

parameters.label: Default Fan Level (Local)
parameters.overview: Default level for the fan dimmer when it is powered on from the local switch.

parameters.label: Light State After Power Restored
parameters.overview: The state the switch should return to once power is restored after power failure. 0 = off, 1-99 = level, 100=previous.

parameters.label: Fan State After Power Restored
parameters.overview: The state the switch should return to once power is restored after power failure.

parameters.label: Light LED Indicator Color
parameters.overview: This is the color of the Light LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Intensity
parameters.overview: This is the intensity of the Light LED strip.

parameters.label: Fan LED Indicator Color
parameters.overview: This is the color of the Fan LED strip represented as part of the HUE color wheel. Since the wheel has 360 values and this parameter only has 255, the following equation can be used to determine the color: value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Intensity
parameters.overview: This is the intensity of the Fan LED strip.

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)
parameters.overview: This is the intensity of the Light LED strip when the switch is off. This is useful for users to see the light switch location when the lights are off.

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Intensity (When OFF)
parameters.overview: This is the intensity of the Light LED strip when the switch is off. This is useful for users to see the light switch location when the lights are off.

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Effect
parameters.overview:
Byte 4: Effect - 0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse

Byte 3: Duration

  • 1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds
  • 61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes
  • 121 - 254 = 1 - 134 hours
  • 255 = Indefinitely

Byte 2: Intensity - 0 to 9. 0 = dim, 9 = bright

Byte 1: Color - 0 - 255. Hue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

Calculator available at: http://calculator.inovelli.com/

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Effect Color
parameters.overview: Hue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Effect Intensity
parameters.overview: 0 = dim, 9 = bright

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Effect Duration
parameters.overview:
• 1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds
  • 61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes
  • 121 to 254 = 1 to 134 hours
  • 255 = Indefinitely

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Effect Type
parameters.overview: 0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Effect
parameters.overview:
Byte 4: Effect - 0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse

Byte 3: Duration

  • 1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds
  • 61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes
  • 121 - 254 = 1 - 134 hours
  • 255 = Indefinitely

Byte 2: Intensity - 0 to 9. 0 = dim, 9 = bright

Byte 1: Color - 0 - 255. Hue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

Calculator available at: http://calculator.inovelli.com/

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Effect Color
parameters.overview: Hue color wheel. value/255 * 360 = Hue color wheel value

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Effect Intesity
parameters.overview: 0 = dim, 9 = bright

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Effect Duration
parameters.overview:
• 1 to 60 = 1 to 60 seconds
  • 61 to 120 = 1 to 60 minutes
  • 121 to 254 = 1 to 134 hours
  • 255 = Indefinitely

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Effect Type
parameters.overview: 0 = Off, 1 = Solid, 2 = Slow Blink, 3 = Fast Blink, 4 = Chase, 5 = Pulse

parameters.label: Light LED Strip Timeout
parameters.overview: When the LED strip is disabled (Light LED Strip Intensity is set to 0), this setting allows the LED strip to turn on temporarily while being adjusted.

parameters.label: Fan LED Strip Timeout
parameters.overview: When the LED strip is disabled (Fan LED Strip Intensity is set to 0), this setting allows the LED strip to turn on temporarily while being adjusted.

parameters.label: Active Power Reports
parameters.overview: The power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 = disabled.

parameters.label: Periodic Power & Energy Reports
parameters.overview: Time period between consecutive power and energy reports being sent (in seconds). The timer is reset after each report is sent.

parameters.label: Energy Reports
parameters.overview: The energy level change that will result in a new energy report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report.

parameters.label: Local Protection Settings
parameters.overview:
Enable local protection on these buttons.

0 = None, 1 = Light, 2 = Fan, 3 = Both

parameters.label: Enable instant on
parameters.overview:
Enable instant on (ie: disable the 700ms delay). Note, if you disable the delay, it will also disable scene control except for Button 1 (ie: tap up 1x or tap down 1x, held & released) and button 6, 7, 8, 9 (level up / down buttons). All other scenes will be disabled.

Firmware v1.36 and above.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: Members of this group will receive unsolicited messages related to the status of the switch.

associations.label: Basic Set Light
associations.overview: Sends On & Off commands to associated devices. (1. Single press UP button sends BasicSet (0xFF) and 2. Single press Down sends BasicSet (0x00)

associations.label: Switch MultiLevel Set Light
associations.overview: Sends set level commands to associated devices when switch is pressed. (1. Hold & Release Up or Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet which keeps associated devices in sync with this device. 2. Single press Up button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0xFF) and 3. Single press Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0x00

associations.label: Switch MultiLevel Start/Stop Light
associations.overview: Sends start / stop level change to associated devices.(1. Hold Up button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Up) 2: Hold Down button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Down) 3. Release Either button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_STOP_LEVEL_CHANGE

associations.label: Basic Set Fan
associations.overview: Sends On & Off commands to associated devices. (1. Single press UP button sends BasicSet (0xFF) and 2. Single press Down sends BasicSet (0x00)

associations.label: Switch MultiLevel Set Fan
associations.overview: Sends set level commands to associated devices when switch is pressed. (1. Hold & Release Up or Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet which keeps associated devices in sync with this device. 2. Single press Up button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0xFF) and 4. Single press Down button sends SwitchMultiLevelSet(0x00)

associations.label: Switch MultiLevel Start/Stop Fan
associations.overview: Sends start / stop level change to associated devices.(1. Hold Up button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Up) 2: Hold Down button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_START_LEVEL_CHANGE (Down) 3. Release Either button sends SW_MULTILEVEL_STOP_LEVEL_CHANGE
